Sorry if that was long, just didn't want to miss something and make you deal with it later on, and then subsequently worsening your experience with the series. Hope you have fun!

Also the controls are arrow keys to move, Z to shoot, X to bomb, Shift to slow down and condense your shots, the games sometimes have another button tied to the gimmick mechanics but 6, 7, and 8 don't so don't worry about that

Also get the games from moriyashrine.org, Touhou 10 and above (with 9 on the way) are on steam if you want to support the creator ZUN, but 8 and below aren't so get it from there as they also have it prepatched with an English translation. To download the games just go to moriyashrine.org then click on menu, go to downloads, then scroll down to most downloaded or top official downloads, then choose the game, then click download this file, and don't download the unpatched version, download the one with touhou XX - name of the game.zip.torrent, then unzip the file and click on the exe with the english TouhouXX and not the Japanese one with 東方XX, and then just play the game

Also play on normal mode or higher, the jump in difficulty from easy to normal is fucking lunacy, some parts of stages can't even kill you in easy unless you're actively trying to get killed. So if you start on easy and get used to that level of difficulty and then later on junp to normal it's gonna fuck you up, so just start with normal or higher. Also you can't even get the good ending on some games in easy mode

.@[]TheImperialLoliconAlliance[] either start with touhou 6, 7, or 8; touhou 1-5 aren't generally considered canon. Touhou 8 Imperishable Night is generally considered to be the easiest touhou game. Touhou 7 Perfect Cherry Blossom is also generally considered to be very easy in comparison to the other games, though I will say that it's because of gimmick mechanics and not the actual bullet patterns themselves so if you don't get a hang of the gimmicks I'd actually say it's fairly normal difficulty for the series. And lastly, Touhou 6 Embodiment of Scarlet Devil, generally considered to be the start of the series, is also considered on the higher end of difficulty for the series, and it has ZERO gimmick mechanics, so if you want the barebones of the series start with touhou 6
